column4: Im in Partition Magic right now, and wish to know what happens if I delete the Linux and Linux Swap partition. Will I just need to fix MBR?
if you are going to have to fix the mbr, then don't delete them in the first place
what are you trying to do?
I must delete linux
why?  and, if so, what exactly do you think you would be fixing in the mbr?
I just want windows for now, I need those partitions, and I would need to fix mbr because GRUB is installed as master, right?
no
well, not as you wrote it
you can install the windows boot loader which will cover up grub.  that will happen automatically if you do a windows install, or you can do it manually
but that doesn't really have any interaction with the partitions, other than sharing the same sector
you don't have to delete partitions to lose grub
ok, that's a separate issue
if you want the space, take the space, but it has no impact on installing the windows boot loader over grub
I think what you are asking is, will grub stop working if you delete linux, and the answer is yes, if you have a typical isntallation
if by "repair the mbr" you mean install the windows boot loader, then yes.
I know, I'm just clearing up what interacts with what
can I fix MBR without the disc? Maybe a batch file on a usb of some sort?
if you haven't killed linux yet, you can
you can boot window, and then use windows to install the windows boot loader
if you've already killed linux, you'll need a bootable cd (well, media) of some sort
these I assume?
that looks promising, definitely
